intro: Eugenioides pallidum, commonly known as the pale eugenioid, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Eugenioides pallidum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
